title: Enhance KidsLearn with multilingual alphabet, poems, and numbers sections

requirements.summary: Enhance the Alphabet & Letters section to display big, colorful letters for all 4 languages (English, Telugu, Hindi, Tamil) with corresponding picture illustrations and words in all 4 languages, with text-to-speech support
acceptanceCriteria: Letters are displayed in a large, bold, colorful font suitable for young children
Each letter card shows the letter, a relevant emoji or picture, and the example word in English, Telugu, Hindi, and Tamil
A language selector allows switching the primary display language between English, Telugu, Hindi, and Tamil
Tapping/clicking a letter card triggers text-to-speech pronunciation in the selected language
Layout is responsive and works on mobile screen sizes for young users

file_operations.description: Replace the current single-language alphabet implementation with a comprehensive multilingual version that displays all 26 English letters (A-Z) in a grid layout. Each letter card must show: the letter in large bold text, the generated illustration from frontend/public/assets/generated/alphabet-{letter}.dim_200x200.png (e.g., alphabet-a.dim_200x200.png for A), and the example word in all 4 languages (English, Telugu in Telugu script, Hindi in Devanagari, Tamil in Tamil script). Add a language selector dropdown at the top to switch the primary display language. Implement onClick handlers for each card that use the Web Speech API to pronounce the letter and word in the selected language. Ensure cards are large, colorful, and use kid-friendly styling with responsive grid layout (grid-cols-2 on mobile, grid-cols-4 on tablet, grid-cols-6 on desktop). Store all language data as hardcoded Unicode string literals in the component. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Enhance the Poems & Nursery Rhymes section to include pre-built classic rhymes for all 4 languages with native script display and text-to-speech read-aloud functionality
acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 pre-built poems/rhymes are available for each of the 4 languages
Poems are displayed in their native script (Latin for English, Telugu script, Devanagari for Hindi, Tamil script)
Each poem card has a read-aloud button that uses the Web Speech API to speak the poem in the correct language
Poems are organized by language with a clear language tab or filter selector
Cards are colorful, illustrated with a relevant emoji or icon, and visually engaging for children

file_operations.description: Expand the existing poems page to include at least 3 pre-built classic poems/rhymes for each of the 4 languages: English (e.g., Twinkle Twinkle Little Star, Baa Baa Black Sheep, Humpty Dumpty), Telugu (e.g., Chanda Mama, Amma Andam, Chinni Chinni Aasa), Hindi (e.g., Chanda Mama Door Ke, Machli Jal Ki Rani Hai, Aloo Kachaloo), and Tamil (e.g., Aaduvome Pallu Paduvome, Chinna Chinna Aasai, Kannan Vanthan). Store all poem text as hardcoded Unicode string literals in their native scripts. Add a language tab/filter selector at the top to filter poems by language. Each poem card should display the poem title, a relevant emoji icon, the full poem text in native script, and a prominent read-aloud button that uses the Web Speech API with the correct language code (en-US, te-IN, hi-IN, ta-IN). Ensure cards are colorful with distinct background colors per language and use large, readable fonts suitable for children. Maintain the expandable card pattern if already present, or implement collapsible poem content for better mobile UX.
